column4: hello, was wondering if anyone has ever used one of these sata -> usb converters. i suddenly have a mount problem using one
although i can see in dmesg that it is recognising the disk, i cannot mount it
nup stefg
but i see it in /dev/ as /dev/sdc
but not as /dev/sdc1 which is what i think it probably should come up as
ok stefg
is there anyway to repair that?
its this converter that did it. i accidentally plugged in the usb part before pluggin in the a/c power to the disk. :/
hoping the disk isnt completely ruined
does this drive have any data on it?
do you think it is faulty?
ah
oh ok - maybe try looking at testdisc and recovering partition info then fscking the disk if its lost its partition info
thats only needed if there is no partition info but if you see no sdc1 then its probable
are you sure it is sdc the data is on?
well i unplugged it and replugged it in, and theres /dev/sdb and /dev/sdc listed. its also the only usb hdd plugged in right now
is that part of something else?
my bad - its testdisk (with a k)
i havent used it much I'm afraid - I just know it's meant to recover the partition table
http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk
that looks like it has some decent documentation - good luck with the drive
